Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2009 01:50PM chrysanthemum wrote: I know what you mean.  I have been stage IV for two years now.   I am still working full time and sometimes, I am too tired to be at work, but I go anyway.  Anything is better than sitting around worrying and thinking dismal thoughts.  I get tired of people who tell me I should be resting.  For what?  I get plenty of rest.  I am just trying to go on living in a functional way as long as I can.  I hope I can keep my boat anchored for a very long time!   What really irks me is when I go to a clinic not associated with oncology and the first question is "what is your prognosis?"  I always respond by saying I do not know and do no want to talk about it.  I know they are asking so they can base treatment on the prognosis, but I do not want to go there.  I am intelligent and I know the statistics, but who wants them run down their throat?  I figure I will be here as long as I am supposed to be and no one but God has that answer!  Stage IVs - let's just keep on fighting and holding tight to that anchor!!!
Posts.Title: Advice for metsters konakat RobinWendy

Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2009 01:34AM - edited Aug 30, 2009 01:35AM by chrysanthemum Hi Carla,  I am sorry you received such disappointing news.  I, too, have liver mets.  My oncologist reassures me that there are many treatments available.  Please hang in there.  You are in my thoughts!!  I hope you have been able to speak with your doctor.
